doc.repnme: La asociacion de usuarios en la gestion de servicios de agua en localidades rurales multiples : el caso de el Ingenio en Ica, Nasca, Peru
doc.abstracts: This note states that water shortages from remote sources are frequently the result of the implementation of supply systems serving simultaneously several towns in the countryside. In this type of systems, management is the key for the sustainability of the service, and organization is more complex than those that serve a single community or town. The experience of the water system of Ingenio (Nazca, Ica) providing eleven towns and operating since 1995 shows that the User Association operation and maintenance service management model is a feasible, efficient and stronger system that strengthens sustainability of services. This case highlights the importance of community participation choice management model and in establishing clear rules to control service.
